bibl.title: Letter from William and Martha Church to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940

div1.p: The Churches send Hench congratulations and thanks for the invitation to the Washington and Jefferson College exercises, but it is impossible for them to attend.

div1.head: Letter from William and Martha Church to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940
div1.opener:
5206 Ellsworth Ave.,
Pittsburgh, Pa.
MCM
Dear Philip-
div1.p:
Thank you for sending us the
invitation to the W. & J. Founders' Day
exercises.

Nothing would please us more
than to be at the banquet Saturday Eve.
and hear your address, but we find it
impossible to attend.

May we offer you our sincerest
congratulations for the honors to be bestowed
upon you. You deserve them all we
are sure.

Your Mother is so modest
about it but I am sure the trip to
Lafayette & your visit here at this
AC
LM
time is just about the best tonic
for good health that can come to her.

With my best wishes for future
successes & love to you and Mary
div1.closer: Most Cordially, William & Martha Church. Oct. 24. 1940.
